alert.note: Alert for Jasper (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 03 at 1:49PM EST until March 08 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Indiana... Iroquois River at Rensselaer affecting Jasper County. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near Rensselaer downstream to near I-65 east of Foresman, including the Rensselaer gauge. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Low-lying agricultural land inundated. Parking lots threatened at Lairds Landing. At 14.0 feet, A couple homes threatened in Rensselaer. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached as early as Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 24 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 24 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Saturday morning.
